Interface CoreTpi

All Known Subinterfaces:
BasicJtapiTpi, CCTpi, FullJtapiTpi, MediaTpi, PrivateDataTpi, TelephonyProvider
public interface CoreTpi

This is the basic set of functionality common to JTAPI and Jcc Creation date: (2000-10-04 13:44:49)

answerCall

public void answerCall(CallId call,
                       java.lang.String address,
                       java.lang.String terminal)
                throws javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                       javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException,
                       javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException,
                       RawStateException
Answer a call that has appeared at a particular terminal
Parameters:
call - The system identifier for the call
address - The address of the connection that is ringing.
terminal - the terminal to answer the call on.
Throws:
RawStateException - A holder for a low-level state problem.

createCall

public CallId createCall(CallId id,
                         java.lang.String address,
                         java.lang.String term,
                         java.lang.String dest)
                  throws javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException,
                         javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                         javax.telephony.InvalidPartyException,
                         javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                         RawStateException,
                         javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException
Make a call. Not that this follows the JTAPI sematics of an idle call being created synchronusly (two connections). Events from the raw provider will indicate state transitions.
Parameters:
id - The callId reserved for the call.
address - The logical address to make a call from
term - The physical address for the call, if applicable
dest - The destination address
Returns:
A call Id. This may be used later to track call progress.
Throws:
RawStateException - One of the objects is not in the correct state.

getCapabilities

public java.util.Properties getCapabilities()
Ask the raw provider to update the capabilities offered by the provider This is expected to return a map of capability names to strings. If the string starts with 't' or 'T', the capability is turned on, otherwise it is turned off. Alternatively Boolean values can be used. If the value is not found for a key, the default value is used.

To use this feature, the RawProvider needs to copy the GenericCapabilities.props file and change any properties that are supported differently. The the RawProvider could load the properties file into a Properties object and return it. If the default value is supported, then the corresponding line may be omitted from the file. Creation date: (2000-03-14 14:48:36)

Returns:
A properties file with name to value pairs for the basic raw provider functions.

initialize

public void initialize(java.util.Map props)
                throws javax.telephony.ProviderUnavailableException
This allows for any context-specific parameters to be set. The map may include such pairs as "name"="xxx" or "password"="yyy". The provider is not active until this has been called. The property map may be null. Creation date: (2000-02-11 12:13:36)
Parameters:
props - The name value properties map

releaseCallId

public void releaseCallId(CallId id)
Tell the provider that it may release a call id for future use. This is necessary to ensure that TelephonyProvider call ids are not reused until the Generic JTAPI Framework layer is notified of the death of the call. Creation date: (2000-02-17 22:25:48)
Parameters:
id - The CallId that may be freed.

reserveCallId

public CallId reserveCallId(java.lang.String address)
                     throws javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException
Tell the provider to reserve a call id for future use. The provider does not have to hang onto it. Creation date: (2000-02-16 14:48:48)
Parameters:
term - The address that the call will start on. Used by muxes to isolate the correct provider.
Returns:
The CallId created by the provider.
Throws:
javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException - If the Address is not in the provider's domain.
